intro: Brackenridgea foxworthyi, commonly known as the Foxworthys brackenridgea, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant is known for its distinctive, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
